glsa.title: Cpio: Buffer overflow
glsa.synopsis: GNU cpio contains a buffer overflow vulnerability, possibly resulting in a Denial of Service.

background.p: GNU cpio copies files into or out of a cpio or tar archive.

description.p: A buffer overflow vulnerability in the safer_name_suffix() function in GNU cpio has been discovered.

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted archive file resulting in a stack-based buffer overflow, possibly crashing the application. It is disputed whether the execution of arbitrary code is possible.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All GNU cpio users should upgrade to the latest version:
